comments:
I created a dynamic web project, then created one class in the JavaSource-
Folder of the project. After that I invoke the New Web Service - Whizzard. I 
leave the fields of the whizzard like they are initial and press next. In the 
next formular of the whizzard (object selection page) I choose the Java Class 
of the dynamic web project. When I now finish the dialog, the following 
exception occurs:

Peter, this looks like a pretty basic bug. Please try reproducing it on the 
latest integration build.

Matthias, a few questions:
1. Have you configured a server prior to running the wizard? If so, which type 
of server?
2. Is your Java class in a package?
3. Have you tried pressing Next instead of Finish from the Object Selection 
Page?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Peter, this looks like a pretty basic bug. Please try reproducing it on the 
> latest integration build.
> Matthias, a few questions:
> 1. Have you configured a server prior to running the wizard? If so, which 
type 
> of server?
> 2. Is your Java class in a package?
> 3. Have you tried pressing Next instead of Finish from the Object Selection 
> Page?

I configured Apache Tomcat 5.5 prior to running the wizzard. My Java class
is in a package. If I press next, the same error occurs. There is no way for
me to create a Web Service. I also tried the latest integration build.

Can you try using a Tomcat 5.0 or earlier server and see if you still run into 
the same problem.  Tomcat 5.5 requires jdk1.5 and Axis 1.2.  We currently don't 
support Axis 1.2, since the Eclipse legal department hasn't approved it yet.  
If we get this approval in time hopefully, we can get Axis 1.2 into the 0.7 
release.  For now I'd suggest using Tomcat 5.0 or earlier.  Thanks.
Since, Tomcat 5.5 requires Axis 1.2 I'm deferring this defect.

(In reply to comment #3)
> Can you try using a Tomcat 5.0 or earlier server and see if you still run 
into 
> the same problem.  Tomcat 5.5 requires jdk1.5 and Axis 1.2.  We currently 
don't 
> support Axis 1.2, since the Eclipse legal department hasn't approved it yet.  
> If we get this approval in time hopefully, we can get Axis 1.2 into the 0.7 
> release.  For now I'd suggest using Tomcat 5.0 or earlier.  Thanks.

I just tried it using tomcat 5.0. The same problem occurs. I just followed the 
steps in the tutorial "Bottom Up Web Service Supporting Flexible Projects" and 
by this reproduce the bug.

I've gone through the Java Bean tutorial using the WTP RC1 driver with the 
Tomcat 5.0 server target and I am still not able to reproduce this problem.  
Which driver are you seeing this problem on?  Also, what JDK are you using.  
Thanks.

I can't reproduce this problem.  I'm going to need more information on the 
environment that you are using.

This bug was moved to 'closed' state, since it is so old and since it is a dup, worksforme, invalid bug that its unlikely to still be useful or need further attention. Feel free to re-open, or open a new bug, if this semi-automatic processing was done in error.
